subject: [PATCH] btrfs: read key again after incrementing slot in move_existing_remaps()

reviews.author: Johannes Thumshirn
reviews.summary: Identified the bug in move_existing_remaps() where the objectid and offset of the old item are reused when incrementing the slot. Approved the patch as it fixes this issue.

2026-02-25.patch_summary: This patch fixes a bug in the btrfs relocation code by ensuring that when incrementing the slot in move_existing_remaps(), the objectid and offset of the old item are not reused if the encountered key is not a REMAP_BACKREF. This change prevents potential double-put bugs.

2026-02-27.patch_summary: This patch fixes a bug in the btrfs relocation code by ensuring that when incrementing the slot in move_existing_remaps(), the objectid and offset of the old item are not reused if the encountered key is not a REMAP_BACKREF. This change prevents potential double-put bugs.
